VIBE_DEVCAPTYPE_DEVICE_CATEGORY

public static final int VIBE_DEVCAPTYPE_DEVICE_CATEGORY
Device capability type to get the device category. Used with Device.getCapabilityInt32. The return value will be one of
  • VIBE_DEVICECATEGORY_VIRTUAL
  • VIBE_DEVICECATEGORY_EMBEDDED
  • VIBE_DEVICECATEGORY_TETHERED

See Also:
Constant Field Values

VIBE_DEVCAPTYPE_MAX_NESTED_REPEATS

public static final int VIBE_DEVCAPTYPE_MAX_NESTED_REPEATS
Device capability type to get the maximum number of nested repeat bars supported for Timeline effects. Any repeat bars nested beyond this level will be played only once. Used with Device.getCapabilityInt32.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

Constant Field Values

VIBE_DEVCAPTYPE_NUM_EFFECT_SLOTS

public static final int VIBE_DEVCAPTYPE_NUM_EFFECT_SLOTS
Device capability type to get the number of effect slots present on the device. The number of effect slots represents the maximum number of simple effects that may play simultaneously. If an attempt is made to play more than this number of effects at the same time, some of the simple effects will not play. Used with Device.getCapabilityInt32.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

VIBE_DEVCAPTYPE_SUPPORTED_STYLES

public static final int VIBE_DEVCAPTYPE_SUPPORTED_STYLES
Device capability type to get the supported effect styles. Used with Device.getCapabilityInt32. The return value will be a bitwise ORing of
  • VIBE_STYLE_SMOOTH_SUPPORT
  • VIBE_STYLE_STRONG_SUPPORT
  • VIBE_STYLE_SHARP_SUPPORT

See Also:

VIBE_DEVCAPTYPE_APIVERSIONNUMBER

public static final int VIBE_DEVCAPTYPE_APIVERSIONNUMBER
Device capability type to get the API version number. Used with Device.getCapabilityInt32. The return value format is OxMMNNSPBB, where
  • MM is the API major version number
  • NN is the minor version number
  • SP is the special build number (typically 0)
  • BB is the build number
For example, for 0x034001F the version number is 3.4.31.0.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

VIBE_DEVCAPTYPE_MAX_IVT_SIZE_TETHERED

public static final int VIBE_DEVCAPTYPE_MAX_IVT_SIZE_TETHERED
Device capability type to get the maximum size in bytes for IVT files that can be played on a tethered device. Used with Device.getCapabilityInt32.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

VIBE_DEVCAPTYPE_HANDSET_INDEX

public static final int VIBE_DEVCAPTYPE_HANDSET_INDEX
Device capability type to get the handset index. Used with Device.getCapabilityInt32. The return value will always be zero on embedded devices.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

VIBE_DEVPROPTYPE_LICENSE_KEY

public static final int VIBE_DEVPROPTYPE_LICENSE_KEY
Device property type to set the OEM licence key associated with a device handle. Used with Device.setPropertyString. This property is write-only. It can be set to an OEM license key issued by Immersion in order to use higher priority levels not normally available to applications, or to set the master strength. On devices with API version 3.2 or lower, applications must always set this property in order to unlock the ability to play effects.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

VIBE_DEVPROPTYPE_PRIORITY

public static final int VIBE_DEVPROPTYPE_PRIORITY
Device property type to get/set the priority of effects associated with a device handle. Used with Device.getPropertyInt32 and Device.setPropertyInt32. Different applications can use different priorities on the same device. The priority determines which application's effects are played when multiple applications attempt to play effects at the same time. The default priority is VIBE_MIN_DEVICE_PRIORITY. Priority values range from VIBE_MIN_DEVICE_PRIORITY to VIBE_MAX_DEV_DEVICE_PRIORITY, or from VIBE_MIN_DEVICE_PRIORITY to VIBE_MAX_OEM_DEVICE_PRIORITY after calling Device.setPropertyString with the VIBE_DEVPROPTYPE_LICENSE_KEY device property type to set an OEM license key.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

VIBE_DEVPROPTYPE_DISABLE_EFFECTS

public static final int VIBE_DEVPROPTYPE_DISABLE_EFFECTS
Device property type to enable/disable effects associated with a device handle. When this property is set to true, the Player immediately stops any playing effects and ignores subsequent requests to play effects. When this property is false, the Player honors requests to play effects. Used with Device.getPropertyBool and Device.setPropertyBool.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

VIBE_DEVPROPTYPE_STRENGTH

public static final int VIBE_DEVPROPTYPE_STRENGTH
Device property type to get/set the overall strength for all effects associated with a device handle. Used with Device.getPropertyInt32 and Device.setPropertyInt32. The strength varies from VIBE_MIN_MAGNITUDE (equivalent to mute) to VIBE_MAX_MAGNITUDE (full strength). The default value is VIBE_MAX_MAGNITUDE. The strength only applies to the device instance passed to Device.getPropertyInt32 or Device.setPropertyInt32, not to other device instances held by the same or a different application. Modifying the strength does not affect currently playing effects, only effects played or modified after calling Device.setPropertyInt32 to use a new strength.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

VIBE_DEVPROPTYPE_MASTERSTRENGTH

public static final int VIBE_DEVPROPTYPE_MASTERSTRENGTH
Device property type to get/set the overall master strength for all effects associated with all device handles. Used with Device.getPropertyInt32 and Device.setPropertyInt32. The master strength varies from VIBE_MIN_MAGNITUDE (equivalent to mute) to VIBE_MAX_MAGNITUDE (full strength). The default value is VIBE_MAX_MAGNITUDE. The master strength applies to all effects on the device, including effects from other applications. Modifying the master strength immediately affects currently playing effects and subsequently played or modified effects. Before changing the master strength, applications must call Device.setPropertyString with the VIBE_DEVPROPTYPE_LICENSE_KEY device property type to set an OEM license key, and Device.setPropertyInt32 with the VIBE_DEVPROPTYPE_PRIORITY device property type to associate the maximum OEM priority (VIBE_MAX_OEM_DEVICE_PRIORITY) with the device handle.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

VIBE_MAX_OEM_DEVICE_PRIORITY

public static final int VIBE_MAX_OEM_DEVICE_PRIORITY
Maximum device priority for OEM applications. Returned by Device.getPropertyInt32 or used with Device.setPropertyInt32 for the VIBE_DEVPROPTYPE_PRIORITY device property type. This priority level can be set only after calling Device.setPropertyString with the VIBE_DEVPROPTYPE_LICENSE_KEY device property type to set an OEM license key.

VIBE_BUILTINEFFECT_SHORT_ON_SHORT_OFF

public static final int VIBE_BUILTINEFFECT_SHORT_ON_SHORT_OFF
Effect index for the short-on-short-off effect in the API's built-in IVT file. Used with
  • Device.playIVTEffect
  • Device.playIVTEffectDelayed
Used when playing effects from the IVT file returned by getBuiltInEffects. This effect plays a short vibration followed by a short rest, repeated indefinitely.

See Also:

Method Detail

getInstance

public static ImmVibe getInstance(Context context)
Gets the single instance of this class.

Returns:
The single instance of this class.
Throws:
java.lang.RuntimeException - The detail message of the exception may consist of the following values:
"ImmEmulator was not installed properly"
No TouchSense version was detected on the device and the TouchSense emulator (ImmEmulator) is incorrectly installed.

getDeviceCount

public int getDeviceCount()
Gets the number of available actuators.

Returns:
Number of available actuators.
Throws:
java.lang.RuntimeException - The detail message of the exception may consist of the following values:
"VIBE_E_FAIL"
Error getting the device count.
"VIBE_E_SERVICE_BUSY"
The Player Service is busy and could not complete the request.

getBuiltInEffects

public byte[] getBuiltInEffects()
Retrieves the built-in IVT effect data. The built-in IVT data provides a set of effects that can be played by calling
  • Device.playIVTEffect
  • Device.playIVTEffectDelayed
  • Device.playIVTEffectRepeat
  • Device.playIVTEffectRepeatDelayed

Returns:
Built-in IVT effect data.

deleteIVTFile

public void deleteIVTFile(java.lang.String pathName)
Removes an IVT file from persistent storage.

Parameters:
pathName - Path name of the file to remove.
Throws:
java.lang.RuntimeException - The detail message of the exception may consist of the following values:
"VIBE_E_INVALID_ARGUMENT"
The pathName parameter is invalid.
"VIBE_E_FAIL"
Error removing the IVT file.
"VIBE_E_SERVICE_BUSY"
The Player Service is busy and could not complete the request.
